JobFullDesc: About Us: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers.Job Summary: Work remotely! Our Global Supply Change Management organization has an opportunity for a talented professional to join our team in a critical Supplier Engineering role within who will be involved in all aspects of planning and executing the production of our wide range of weapon systems, from tactical missiles to strategic defense products. You will provide technical knowledge & process capability expertise to improve supplier performance. You will be involved in all phases of product life cycles, beginning with proposal development, new product development, advanced manufacturing initiatives and continuing through production implementation. You will ensure technical data packages are complete and accurate and that the supplier technical performance meets the objectives of quality, cost and schedule. You will drive Raytheon design requirements to improve manufacturing and quality capabilities of suppliers. You will initiate continuous and measurable design and process improvement of supplier hardware for affordability. Responsibilities to Anticipate: Communicate and translate the technical data package to suppliersConduct supplier engagements related to capability, capacity, opportunity and riskPerform technical evaluations in support of cost and price analysisManage supplier requests for product and process changesManage product non-conformances; Drive root cause and corrective actionPrioritize and execute improvement opportunitiesCommunicate the technical health of our suppliers to stakeholdersSupport travel as needed (minimum 30%)Qualifications You Must Have:Bachelor’s in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) Minimum 2 years’ relevant experience such as electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, system engineering, manufacturing & quality systems, technical supplier managementThe ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearanceQualifications We Value: Master’s Degree in the following Majors: Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing/Process/Industrial Engineering, Systems Engineering, Environmental Engineering or Environmental ScienceExisting Secret ClearanceExperience in Statement of Work (SOW) generationExperience with design and development of products that fall within the electrical or mechanical engineering disciplineExperience performing supplier assessmentFamiliarity of Export/Import regulationWhat We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.Check us out on YouTube!   https://www.youtube.com/raytheontechnologiesAdditional Details:This job is posted internally as: Manufacturing Engineer II  Clearance Information: This position requires the eligibility to obtain a security clearance.
